intro: Antholyza fucata, commonly known as the golden starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators like bees and flies. Antholyza fucata is a herbaceous perennial that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters.
